Sentence.sentence: Unilever recently ran an interactive campaign for its Axe deodorant ( ' ,  除臭剂), which kept viewers engaged for more than three minutes on average.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: These less- stressed workers gained an average of 62 minutes per week of productivity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It would all be innocent enough—20 minutes of busy work—except it comes attached to a personal essay.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many admissions officers say they spend less than a couple of minutes on each application, including the essay
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: the man whose horse trots（奔跑）a mile in a minute does not carry the most important messages.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For more than 20 years, therefore, I have been going several times a year-often for no longer than three days-to a Benedictine hermitage（修道院）,40 minutes down the road, as it happens, from the Post Ranch Inn.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Not only does she have a tendency to be moody all the time, but she misses appointments, doesn't follow through on projects, and doesn't seem to plan anything till the last minute.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Yes, he did a really fine job, filling in for Marsha like that at the last minute
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He will be back in a minute to repair the computers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Near the end of the 25 minutes she had set, Delia said she would take two more questions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: M :I left 20 pages here to copy ,here's the receipt W : I'm sorry ,sir ,but we are a little behind ,could you come back in a few minutes
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "We worry most about now because if we don't survive for the next minute, we're not going to be around in ten years' time," says Professor Elke Weber of the Centre for Research on Environmental Decisions at Columbia University in New York.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But these waterways seem minute in comparison to the world's two lengthiest rivers—the Nile and the Amazon.

Sentence.sentence: If every distraction took only 1 minute, that would account for 2.5 hours a day.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"小的"之意。
means: little ： 指在体积、数量、距离、年龄、身材等方面比正常的小，多带主观感情色彩，含小而可爱或小巧的意味。
small ： 多指数量、面积、体积、价值、数字或意义等的小或少，指略小于正常的大小。
tiny ： 强调与同类或其他物体比较，小得超
出正常比例，有时带强烈的感情色彩。
minute ： 指小得难看见，有时需用显微镜才看得见。
miniature ： 指由正常体积微缩的物体。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"瞬间，片刻"之意。
means: moment较minute所表示的时间短，指一刹那或一段很短时间。有时也含持续的意味。
minute ： 指极短的时间，但可觉察到时间的持续。
instant常与moment换用，指一瞬间，但更侧重时间短促，多用于表示紧迫、瞬变等情况。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+min伸出,突出+ent……的→adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
im进入+min伸出,突出+ent……的→伸进来的→即将发生的
pro向前+min伸+ent……的→向前伸出→杰出的
pre前+eminent突出的→向前突出的→杰出的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 用草写小字写的, 极小的
stems_affixes.word_buile: min小+uscule表形容词或名词→小的→极小的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 卓越的, 极为出色的
stems_affixes.word_buile: super过度,极度+eminent[adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的]→adj.卓越的, 极为出色的
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修
minute微小的+ial表形容词→小事件→琐事
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ute→n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的
e出+min伸出,突出+ence表名词→n.卓越,杰出
pro向前+min伸+ence表名词→向前伸出→杰出
minute[[n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的]]→n.菜单
min小+uscule表形容词或名词→小的→极小的
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修
minor小或者少+ity表名词→少的状态→少数
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ute→n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ify使……化→小化
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修

jx.jx_en_mean: (especially of the progress of a change) very rapidly
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指变化进程）迅速地，极快地

lj.lj_ly: matters grew worse by the minute.

jx.jx_en_mean: used as a request to delay an action, departure, or decision for a short time, usually to allow the speaker to do something

lj.lj_ly: wait a minute—I have to put my make-up on.

jx.jx_en_mean: as a prelude to a challenge, query, or objection

lj.lj_ly: wait a minute—that just isn't true.
don't think for a minute that our pricing has affected our quality standards.
lj.lj_ls: 千万不要认为我们的定价影响了我们的质量标准。

phrase.cizu_name: this minute (或 this very minute) informal 非正式

lj.lj_ly: I've &B{just this minute} got back to the flat.

entry.def: A minute is one of the sixty parts that an hour is divided into. People often say 'a minute' or 'minutes' when they mean a short length of time.

example.ex: The pizza will then take about twenty minutes to cook...
example.tran: 然后比萨饼做出来大约要用20分钟的时间。

example.ex: Bye Mum, see you in a minute...
example.tran: 妈妈，一会儿见。

entry.def: The minutes of a meeting are the written records of the things that are discussed or decided at it.

example.ex: He'd been reading the minutes of the last meeting.
example.tran: 他刚才一直在阅读上次会议的记录。

entry.def: When someone minutes something that is discussed or decided at a meeting, they make a written record of it.

example.ex: You don't need to minute that.
example.tran: 你不必把那一点记入会议记录。

entry.def: People often use expressions such as wait a minute or just a minute when they want to stop you doing or saying something.

example.ex: Wait a minute, folks, something is wrong here...
example.tran: 等一下，伙计们，这里有点不对劲。

example.ex: Hey, just a minute!
example.tran: 嗨，等一下！

entry.def: If you say that something will or may happen at any minute or any minute now, you are emphasizing that it is likely to happen very soon.

example.ex: It looked as though it might rain at any minute...
example.tran: 看上去好像马上就要下雨了。

example.ex: He ought to be back any minute...
example.tran: 他应该随时都会回来。

entry.def: If you say that you do not believe for a minute or for one minute that something is true, you are emphasizing that you do not believe that it is true.

example.ex: I don't believe for one minute she would have been scared...
example.tran: 我压根不认为她会有所畏惧。

example.ex: I don't believe him for a minute.
example.tran: 我一点也不相信他。

entry.def: A last-minute action is one that is done at the latest time possible.
entry.tran: 最后关头; 最后一刻

example.ex: She was doing some last-minute revision for her exams...
example.tran: 她在为考试进行最后的复习。

example.ex: The location has been changed at the last minute...
example.tran: 在最后一刻改变了地点。

entry.def: You use the expression the next minute or expressions such as 'one minute he was there, the next he was gone' to emphasize that something happens suddenly.
entry.tran: 下一刻(强调事情发生得很突然)

example.ex: The next minute my father came in...
example.tran: 接着我父亲突然进来了。

example.ex: Jobs are there one minute, gone the next.
example.tran: 工作机会稍纵即逝。

entry.def: If you say that something happens the minute something else happens, you are emphasizing that it happens immediately after the other thing.

example.ex: The minute you do this, you'll lose control...
example.tran: 你一旦做了这件事，就会失去控制。

example.ex: The minute that the war started, everybody was glued to the television.
example.tran: 战事一起，所有人都盯紧了电视报道。

entry.def: If you say that something must be done this minute, you are emphasizing that it must be done immediately.

example.ex: I need to speak with her right this minute...
example.tran: 我现在就需要跟她谈谈。

example.ex: Anna, stop that. Sit down this minute.
example.tran: 安娜，住手。马上坐下。

entry.def: If you say that something is minute, you mean that it is very small.
entry.tran: 非常细小的;十分微小的

example.ex: Only a minute amount is needed...
example.tran: 只需要很少的一点点。

example.ex: The party was planned in the minutest detail.
example.tran: 晚会策划极为详细。

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of time equal to 60 seconds or 1/60th of an hour;

sentences.sentence: "the moment he arrived the party began"

means.word_mean: 4. a unit of angular distance equal to a 60th of a degree

sentences.sentence: "the secretary keeps the minutes of the meeting"

means.word_mean: 6. distance measured by the time taken to cover it;

sentences.sentence: "we live an hour from the airport"

means.word_mean: 3. characterized by painstaking care and detailed examination;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin minuta, feminine (used as a noun) of minutus 'made small'. The senses 'period of sixty seconds' and 'sixtieth of a degree' derive from medieval Latin pars minuta prima 'first minute part'
late Middle English (in the sense 'lesser', with reference to a tithe or tax): from Latin minutus 'lessened', past participle of minuere

late Middle English (in the singular in the sense 'note or memorandum'): from French minute, from the notion of a rough copy in ‘small writing’ (Latin scriptura minuta) as distinct from the fair copy in book hand. The verb dates from the mid 16th cent

Sentence.sentence: To get maximum benefit from walking, aim for 45 minutes a day, an average of five days a week.

Sentence.sentence: Chris Koch, who teaches "History of Broadcast Journalism" at Montgomery Community College in Rockville, Maryland, points out that reporting is about investigation rather than the memorization of minute details.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: For example, we have quartz crystal clocks and watches accurate to within one minute a year.

Sentence.sentence: The development of fiber-optic cables allowed for billions of bits of information to be received every minute.

Sentence.sentence: There are people who always wait until the last minute, and make it much harder than it needs to be.

Sentence.sentence: We found that the number of bacteria transferred to either kind of food didn't depend much on how long the food was in contact with the contaminated surface——whether for a few seconds or for a whole minute.
